title: 'We offered a $300 bonus to get staff for our restaurant'
description: Restaurants in the United States are struggling to fill jobs as lockdown restrictions ease.

title: Heathrow Airport to open terminal for 'red list' arrivals
description: The airport faced criticism after arrivals from countries with a high Covid risk were made to queue with other passengers.

title: Amazon shuts US construction site as nooses found
description: The online retail giant shut down construction of a factory in Connecticut after seven nooses were found.

title: Apple v Epic: Tim Cook appears on the stand in Epic legal row
description: Apple's boss Tim Cook appears on the witness stand in the high-profile legal row with Epic Games.

title: McDonald's: Animal rights group blockades depots, activists say
description: Animal Rebellion says it is stopping restaurant supplies from leaving four UK distribution centres.

title: Leonard Blavatnik named UK's richest person with £23bn fortune
description: Sir Leonard Blavatnik topples Sir James Dyson as the UK's richest person, according to the Sunday Times Rich List.

title: Retail sales soar 9.2% in April as shops reopen
description: Retail sales jump 9.2% in April as people returning to work and going out "update their wardrobes".

title: 'Mad rush' to buy homes faded in April
description: Property sales fell from the record highs of March, but analysts say activity is still high in the market.

title: UK makes free-trade offer to Australia despite farmers' fears
description: The UK offers to phase out import taxes over 15 years, as UK farmers warn they could go bust.

title: Car buyers still sceptical about going electric, says Ford boss
description: The car giant's UK boss tells the BBC says shifting away from petrol and diesel cars will need more government support.

title: Coronavirus: Spain to lift restrictions for UK and Japanese travellers
description: UK tourists will be free to enter the country without a negative Covid-19 PCR test from Monday.

title: Higher plastic bag charge comes into force in England
description: Single-use plastic carrier bags in English shops now cost 10p, twice the previous price.

title: 'I pay more than £9,000 a year for my season ticket'
description: As rail reforms loom, commuters tell the BBC about the problems they face with UK train services.

title: Somerset hoteliers worry they face mass cancellations
description: Tourism businesses had hoped for a "staycation boom" to repay losses suffered during lockdowns.

title: WeWork reports $2bn loss ahead of stock market debut
description: The troubled office-sharing startup's business was hit particularly hard by the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Oatly: Oprah-backed firm's shares soar in stock market debut
description: The Swedish-based alternative milk brand has been backed by other celebrities such as Jay-Z.

title: Elon Musk UK visit drives Tesla factory rumours
description: A two-day stop in the UK has ignited speculation that the tech mogul is looking for factory sites.

title: Rail reform: What does the shake-up mean for you?
description: How will a government promise to simplify the UK's "complicated" rail network impact passengers and fares.

title: Amber list travel is legal, says EasyJet boss
description: Government guidance on travel to amber list countries is "very confusing", says Johan Lundgren.

title: Australia trade deal: Ministers discuss British farmers' concerns
description: UK sheep and beef farmers are worried they could be undercut in a trade agreement by rivals with larger herds.

title: Out in Brighton on first Friday after rules ease
description: "Life is meant for living and we are living it," says one woman, as people enjoy indoor pubs and restaurants.

title: Why video calls might be behind a rise in male cosmetic surgery
description: A third of UK plastic surgeons say they have seen a jump in enquiries from men over the past year.

title: UK-Australia trade deal: What are the arguments for and against?
description: The government wants to finalise negotiations by early June.

title: CEO Secrets: 'Perfectionism can hold women back'
description: Code First Girls' Anna Brailsford says perfectionism can hold women back, but it can be overcome.

title: Should encryption be curbed to combat child abuse?
description: Cyber-security experts, tech firms and lawyers weigh in on the end-to-end encryption debate.

title: The app that lets you pay to control another person's life
description: NewNew aims to connect artists with their fans who can vote on aspects of their work and daily life.

title: Why is Huawei still in the UK?
description: Huawei defends its links with British universities, says it admires UK innovation

title: Debenhams: 'It's only fixtures and fittings, we'll still be friends'
description: Staff reminisce about the Mansfield branch of Debenhams, which closed this week, after five decades.

title: Building's hard problem - making concrete green
description: Concrete accounts for 8% of carbon dioxide emissions, but some firms are hoping to cut that down.

title: Jeff Bezos and the secretive world of superyachts
description: The world's richest man will reportedly set sail next month on one of the largest superyachts ever built.
